rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about teen safety.

Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe.

Talking together about safe and unsafe places, and how to prevent problems, really helps!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about teen safety.

Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe.

Talking together about safe and unsafe places, and how to prevent problems, really helps!

media_title.eng: Why is teen safety important for you and your family?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today our topic is teen safety.

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities.

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.

rows.media_title: Why is teen safety important for you and your family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today our topic is teen safety.

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities.

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Sometimes our teens know things about their environment that we might not realise - and by talking, we can learn how to support them better.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Sometimes our teens know things about their environment that we might not realise - and by talking, we can learn how to support them better.

media_title.eng: A safety plan helped @data.characters.media_female_8.name protect her teen. Tap play to hear more

media_transcript.eng:
I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of.

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.

rows.media_title: A safety plan helped @data.characters.media_female_8.name protect her teen. Tap play to hear more
rows.media_transcript:
I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of.

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
The most important way to help keep your teen safe is to make sure that they know they can talk to you about anything. 

You can also come up with a Safety Word - a simple word your teen can use to let you know they have a problem, without fear of you getting angry. 

Let's see how this worked for @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her daughter @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
The most important way to help keep your teen safe is to make sure that they know they can talk to you about anything. 

You can also come up with a Safety Word - a simple word your teen can use to let you know they have a problem, without fear of you getting angry. 

Let's see how this worked for @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her daughter @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name:

character_1_text.eng: Something happened when I was out with my friends @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.friend_female_1.name!

rows.character_1_text: Something happened when I was out with my friends @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.friend_female_1.name!
Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what is your name?

character_1_text.eng: Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what is your name?

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you will be back in time, I promise‚Ä¶

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you will be back in time, I promise‚Ä¶

character_2_text.eng: I am not sure if that is a good idea‚Ä¶

rows.character_2_text: I am not sure if that is a good idea‚Ä¶

rows.character_1_text: You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I am telling you, if you do not do this I‚Äôm going to tell everyone you are stupid!

character_1_text.eng: You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I am telling you, if you do not do this I‚Äôm going to tell everyone you are stupid!

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name do not go! Be careful! Let‚Äôs go home. It is dangerous to go with people you do not know. Besides, he is too old for you and what he is doing is wrong.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name do not go! Be careful! Let‚Äôs go home. It is dangerous to go with people you do not know. Besides, he is too old for you and what he is doing is wrong.

rows.character_1_text:
Pfff, I am so proud of you for not getting into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!

You can always call me or talk to me when something like this happens. We can even use a Safety Word, so I know something is wrong - and I promise I will not be angry.

character_1_text.eng:
Pfff, I am so proud of you for not getting into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!

You can always call me or talk to me when something like this happens. We can even use a Safety Word, so I know something is wrong - and I promise I will not be angry.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! Our Safety Word could be ‚Äòblue house‚Äô. I could call and say something like ‚ÄòI forgot my book at the blue house‚Äô and you would know to come help me.

rows.character_2_text: Thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name! Our Safety Word could be ‚Äòblue house‚Äô. I could call and say something like ‚ÄòI forgot my book at the blue house‚Äô and you would know to come help me.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's look at another example of a dangerous situation together.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's look at another example of a dangerous situation together.

character_1_text.eng: My friend has been talking with a guy our age online... She is going to send him photos of herself. Is that better because he is our age?

rows.character_1_text: My friend has been talking with a guy our age online... She is going to send him photos of herself. Is that better because he is our age?

You are a good friend for being worried about her. Sending sexy photos is a real risk too.

Sometimes people are not who they say they are online ‚Äì he could say he is your age but be a 50-year-old man. Or when they break up, he could send those photos to everyone and your friend would feel awful.

character_1_text.eng:
You are a good friend for being worried about her. Sending sexy photos is a real risk too.

Sometimes people are not who they say they are online ‚Äì he could say he is your age but be a 50-year-old man. Or when they break up, he could send those photos to everyone and your friend would feel awful.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Things like that can happen to any teen, so let's think about our teens' online safety.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Things like that can happen to any teen, so let's think about our teens' online safety.

quiz_1_question.eng: What do you think is the biggest online risk for teens these days?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: Adults use social media, gaming and messaging apps and websites to meet teenagers and pressure them to do sexual things

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, this is a serious risk. Some adults may act friendly online but try to trick or pressure teens. Talking openly can help keep your teen safe.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: People post things online to make us hurt other people - like making violence seem cool or spreading hate towards certain races or countries

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, this is a real concern. Some people spread hate or make violence seem normal. Helping your teen think about what they see online can protect them.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: People put things online to convince teenagers to hurt themselves or take their own lives

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, sadly this does happen. Some online spaces can make teens feel hopeless or alone. Checking in often can help keep your teen safe.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: Teenagers share sexy photos, videos or information about themselves, and others use it to embarrass or threaten them

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Yes, this is a real danger. Once something is shared, it can be spread or used to hurt them. Teaching your teen to pause and think before sharing can make a big difference.

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: People can often be nasty to teenagers online - they feel like they can bully people safely

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Yes, online bullying happens a lot because people feel braver behind a screen. Talking about kindness and bullying can help your teen feel supported and know what to do.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand the dangerous situations they could get into! 

Let‚Äôs get practical now, and draw two maps of safe and unsafe places:
- üó∫Ô∏è A map of our community
- üåê A map of apps/websites we use online

Let‚Äôs get practical now, and draw two maps of safe and unsafe places:
- üó∫Ô∏è A map of our community
- üåê A map of apps/websites we use online

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 1: Draw all the important places in your community.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 1: Draw all the important places in your community.

text_2.eng: Draw a map of your teen‚Äôs community, with pictures of all the main places like streets, your house, school, shops, places your teen visits.

rows.text_2: Draw a map of your teen‚Äôs community, with pictures of all the main places like streets, your house, school, shops, places your teen visits.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 2: Choose which places are safe and unsafe.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 2: Choose which places are safe and unsafe.

text_2.eng:
- Which areas on your map are safe for teenagers? CIRCLE these
- Which areas on your map are unsafe for teenagers? CROSS those off
- What makes a place safe or unsafe?
- What could you and your teen do to keep your teen safer?

rows.text_2:
- Which areas on your map are safe for teenagers? CIRCLE these
- Which areas on your map are unsafe for teenagers? CROSS those off
- What makes a place safe or unsafe?
- What could you and your teen do to keep your teen safer?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 3: Identify where you can get support.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 3: Identify where you can get support.

text_2.eng:
Sometimes, we can find ourselves in trouble.

- Where can you and your teen get support when you face a crisis? MARK those areas with a little object like a stone or piece of paper.

rows.text_2:
Sometimes, we can find ourselves in trouble.

- Where can you and your teen get support when you face a crisis? MARK those areas with a little object like a stone or piece of paper.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Step 4: Now recognise the risky places online and how you can make them safer.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Step 4: Now recognise the risky places online and how you can make them safer.

text_2.eng:
- Draw pictures of the apps and websites your teenagers use
- Recognise how good they are at using the web!
- Think about which ones might be unsafe. Why?
- What could you and your teen do to make using the internet safer for your teen and their friends?

rows.text_2:
- Draw pictures of the apps and websites your teenagers use
- Recognise how good they are at using the web!
- Think about which ones might be unsafe. Why?
- What could you and your teen do to make using the internet safer for your teen and their friends?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some skills to help you keep your teen safe!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some skills to help you keep your teen safe!

section_1_text.eng: Make maps with your teen of safe and unsafe areas in your community and online. Talk about how to keep their information, photos and videos private online. Talk about how once something goes online, it stays there forever. They might know an example from their friends.

section_2_text.eng: Make rules with your teen about how they can stay safe in your community (especially in risky areas that cannot be avoided), and how they can safely use the apps and websites that they like.

section_2_extra_text.eng: Remember how @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name and her mother, @data.characters.f1_mother.name, made a rule together to help @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name have fun and stay safe online? It worked well because they made clear rules together in a calm and positive way!

section_3_text.eng: Agree on a Safety Word. If something happens that makes your teen upset, uncomfortable or scared, they can say the Safety Word and you will help them without getting angry or punishing them, even if they were doing something wrong.

section_3_extra_text.eng:
What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:

ü•ë A specific food
üëµüèΩ A specific family member
üêí A specific animal
ü§î Something else

It worked well because they made clear rules together in a calm and positive way!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
If you have not done it together yet, this week's home assignment is to make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places:

1) üó∫Ô∏è Map of your community
2) üåê Map of apps and websites your teen uses

Make sure you are both happy with the safety plan. What really matters is that you talk with your teen as you do this ‚Äì often teens know much more than we do about where it is safe and unsafe!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
If you have not done it together yet, this week's home assignment is to make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places:

1) üó∫Ô∏è Map of your community
2) üåê Map of apps and websites your teen uses

Make sure you are both happy with the safety plan. What really matters is that you talk with your teen as you do this ‚Äì often teens know much more than we do about where it is safe and unsafe!

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you make a safety map with your teen and talk about ways to stay safe online and in your community?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Taking the time to map out safe and unsafe places together helps your teen feel more confident and supported.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Even starting the conversation is a big step towards helping your teen stay safe.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. It can feel hard at first, but small talks about safety make a big difference. Try again when you feel ready.

rows.quiz_1_question: Can you make a safety map with your teen and talk about ways to stay safe online and in your community?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Taking the time to map out safe and unsafe places together helps your teen feel more confident and supported.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: You can do it! Even starting the conversation is a big step towards helping your teen stay safe.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. It can feel hard at first, but small talks about safety make a big difference. Try again when you feel ready.

rows.text_1_facilitator: When teens know they can turn to us without fear, they are more likely to ask for help when something feels unsafe - both offline and online. Talking calmly and making safety plans together builds trust that lasts.

text_1_facilitator.eng: When teens know they can turn to us without fear, they are more likely to ask for help when something feels unsafe - both offline and online. Talking calmly and making safety plans together builds trust that lasts.

media_title.eng: Safety planning helped @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name open up. Hear her story

media_transcript.eng:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me.

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot ‚Äì also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad.

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!

rows.media_title: Safety planning helped @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name open up. Hear her story
rows.media_transcript:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me.

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot ‚Äì also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad.

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Now let's look at an example where something simple, like a Safety Word, can help manage stress and keep your teen safe. 

First, think back to when you were a teenager. Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! Let‚Äôs have a look:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Now let's look at an example where something simple, like a Safety Word, can help manage stress and keep your teen safe. 

First, think back to when you were a teenager. Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! Let‚Äôs have a look:

character_1_text.eng: Don‚Äôt tell the adults, but I am going to a bar with my friends tonight.

character_2_text.eng: Have fun! I told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.

rows.character_1_text: Don‚Äôt tell the adults, but I am going to a bar with my friends tonight.
rows.character_2_text: Have fun! I told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.

rows.character_1_text: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì they will be so angry!

character_1_text.eng: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì they will be so angry!

rows.character_1_text: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì I lied about coming to this party.

character_1_text.eng: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì I lied about coming to this party.

rows.text_1_facilitator: These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name then remembered what their father told them:

text_1_facilitator.eng: These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name then remembered what their father told them:

character_1_text.eng:
I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‚ÄòAunty Cecilia‚Äô as our Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry ‚Äì even if you are doing something you shouldn't be doing.

rows.character_1_text:
I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‚ÄòAunty Cecilia‚Äô as our Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry ‚Äì even if you are doing something you shouldn't be doing.
Hey @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?

character_1_text.eng: Hey @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?

character_2_text.eng: *(on the other side of the phone)* Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?

rows.character_2_text: *(on the other side of the phone)* Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?

rows.character_1_text: (ü§î_thinking_) I think my friends are in trouble. I don‚Äôt want to stop being their friend, but I‚Äôm worried. Maybe @data.characters.f1_father.role_name knows what to do.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Having a Safety Word can help your teen stay safe too. You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‚Äòhelp‚Äô.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Having a Safety Word can help your teen stay safe too. You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‚Äòhelp‚Äô.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.

text_2.eng:
**What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:**

ü•ë A specific food
üëµüèΩ A specific family member

rows.quiz_4_option_5_image_asset:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!

quiz_4_option_2_text.eng:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.

quiz_4_feedback_3.eng:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.

section_1_title.eng:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?
